column28: Description

column9: Arrange tour with Scooter Corkle/Norm Li/Dave Maryniak
Call & email Brad to set up meeting
column28:
Follow up on the discussion with Sam: 
- Brad wants to talk about the adaptability for screening / grading remotely between LA and YVR where it doesn’t have to be Skylab. 
- Need to solve the confidence problem with Vancouver for infrastructure for post. 
- Brad thinks we need a set screening room in LA (Where?). He thinks it’s a problem for having to build it every time. 
- Brad needs to hear the plan about T-Vips and “Screening as a Service”. No more new brick-and-mortar facilities and screening rooms required.
- For scanning and 4K repurposing old film assets for the UltraHD market.
- Brad is open to help us develop the market. however he is very full time with Rovio. 
- Quantifying the production savings on managed color vs: unmanaged color. Sam suggests demonstrating a bunch of problems that occurred on a show where the color was not managed. 
- Find out from Brad what the cost of his last equivalent budget DI’s cost and let’s get some numbers to compare. 
- Brad says people don’t care about the overages as long as it come in under budget.

Quick update on Sausage Party-
Shaun Gordon (Post Coordinator) will be connecting us with Bert Van Brande (VFX Super) at the end of this week to discuss delivering some test material to us.  It sounds like we'll be receiving an 11-shot sequence, in addition to a few independent shots.  From there, Shaun is looking to arrange the following:

Week of June 8-12 (exact date TBD)
Turnover of test material to SKYLAB / 11 shot sequence+

Week of June 15-19 (exact date TBD)
Session: Review Test Material / Preliminary Results
Attendance: VFX Supervisor Bert Van Brande (IMDB)

Week of June 22-26 (exact date TBD)
Session: Review Test Material / Color Session
Attendance: Co-Director Conrad Vernon (IMDB); Co-Director Greg Tiernan (IMDB)

 

Thanks!
Will

William Bartlett | Production Coordination | S K Y L A B

skylabHQ.com | Time Zone: NA Pacific [GMT-8]

-----Original Message-----
From: wbartlett@skylabhq.com [mailto:wbartlett@skylabhq.com]
Sent: Sunday, May 31, 2015 7:53 PM
To: Shaun Gordon
Cc: Function point; Sam Trounce
Subject: Re: Sausage Party - Workflow Design and Testing

 

Thanks for the update, Shaun.

 

All sounds good regarding your rough dates for the upcoming sessions.  If possible, it would be great to avoid Wednesday sessions, however we can definitely shuffle things on our end if you end up needing those days to accommodate your team's schedule.

 

In the mean time, we'll wait to connect regarding delivery of the test material - prior to Bert and crew coming in the week of June 15th.

 

Thanks, and looking forward to hosting you all again shorty!

 

Will

 

 

William Bartlett | Production Coordination | S K Y L A B

Office: 1.604.879.5800 | Cell: 1.604.354.5355

400-122 W 8th Avenue | Vancouver BC | Canada V5Y 1N2 skylabHQ.com | Time Zone: NA Pacific [GMT-8]

 

 

 

 

 

On Sat, 30 May 2015 00:28:47 +0000

  Shaun Gordon  wrote:

> Hello Will!

>

> Just touching base at the end of the week.

>

> I spoke with Bert and it sounds like we’ll be holding off an extra

>week on turning anything over.

>

> We are now aiming for turn over materials the week of June 8.

>

> Bert and his core team of techs would most likely want to see some

>preliminary results the week of June 15.

>

> And we’d want to present a final test/color session to our directors

>during the week of June 22-26.

>

> The good news is in addition to individual shots, we will have a very

>short sequence (11 shots) as well to test conform.

>

> Once Bert and crew hone in on the specific delivery date, I’ll get us

>all in the loop.

>

> Please let me know if you have any questions.

>

> Otherwise have a lovely weekend and I’ll touch base next week!

>

> Thanks,

> Shaun

>

>From: Sam Trounce

>

> Date: Friday, May 22, 2015 at 2:25 PM

> To: Annapurna

>

> Cc: Function point

>, William Bartlett

>

> Subject: RE: Sausage Party - Workflow Design and Testing

>

> Hi Shaun,

>

> Thanks so much for the calls this week. We’re all really excited to

>get going with some test footage from Sausage Party.

>

> Please find a start pack attached - please send that back when you

>have a chance. It simply allows us set up an account for you here,

>helps us understand how you’d like to authorize work and includes some

>information about payment options, along with our terms of service.

>There is no obligation to order work by signing off on this and feel

>free to ask if any questions come up for you.

>

> I have also briefed Will Bartlett (cc’d) who will be yours and Bert's

>point person for coordinating media delivery or work while I’m away

>(May 27 to June 12).

>

> As discussed, there is a point at which we’ll be transitioning from

>demo and proof-of-concept activities and into custom workflow design.

>In the spirit of building confidence with Annapurna as a new client, I

>am happy to offer some of that time at no- or reduced-charge (and

>because we have a vested interest in setting up the show in the best

>‘holistic’ way possible). However, I’ll want to make sure we have a

>good understanding about when that transition point into billable

>services will happen before we get too far ahead with handling media

>from the project itself.

>

> Let's talk about the scope of work for the testing phase next week,

>but for now please feel free to arrange for media to be sent over and

>to continue conversations with our team here on the assumption that

>we’re in no charge territory until further notice.

>

> In the mean time, I hope you have a great weekend and a bit of a break

>from the office moving logistics!

>

> Sam

column28:
Any Other Business

Chris Davies met Sebastian at Siggraph 2015. Sebastian moderated the ACES for VFX presentations and discussion. He was very interested in and supportive of the evolved DI color workflow used for Chappie, and the idea of setting looks early and providing evolved looks to departments during the course of post and VFX work. He supported the idea Chris presented that the quality of VFX work would be much improved if the VFX plates are graded in-context, and that artists have up-to-date looks to check their work with.

Sebastian currently works for a VR content producer in Montreal.


New Action Items

Research Sebastian's background to determine his competencies and potential for partnership
	re-connect with Sebastian post-Siggraph, determine what relational potential exists for Skylab
	discuss color- and look-management challenges with Sebastian relating to DI, VFX, animation...

Look at hours and determine how to divide up the time for creative work.
Review once Chris Davies has had a chance to validate quote
determine if a "shadow conform" is viable for SkyLab (one conform up front)

column9: RE: Editors' Feedback _ Colour Metadata Workflow
column28:
Hi All

Just wanted to give you the heads-up that I contacted both Gary Lam & David Legault regarding them helping us with the Colour Metadata workflow from an editorial perspective. Turns out David L is in Australia, so he wouldn't be around until September, however if we can think of a way for him to do some things remotely, he would probably be game.

Gary IS game, but works days - so he would either be open to coming an evening or an hour here or there over the next couple of weeks.

Please let me know when you think you would be "Gary Ready" and I will let him know when is best for him to aim for.


Andrea

column9: 2015.06.02 - EMAIL - FOLLOW UP: Tim Wilson, Creative Cow Story Opportunity
column28:
Hi Tim!

 

This sounds great! Yes, I would agree that two seperate stories would more smoothly cover the two topics.

 

I am available to start talking about the creative colour for Chappie any time. In regards to the workflow discussion, you are right, we often try to get a few tidbits mentioned wherever we can but, there really hasn’t been a great opportunity for a proper story on our workflow efforts since the Elysium campaign.  There has been a lot of growth in our workflow approach since Elysium,  so there is much to discuss. 

 

Would you like a pitch from us or are you keen to jump in and start to build the stories? Sam mentioned in an earlier thread that it would be useful for us to get a first round of questions from you, just to see what is of most interest and determine your best interviewees for certain aspects. Does that sound doable? I am also available to have a call to discuss in more detail.

 

Let me know what you think.

 

Best,

Andrea

 

Andrea Chlebak | Creative Director / Senior Colorist | SKYLAB

Office: 1.604.879.5800

400 - 122 W. 8th Ave | Vancouver BC Canada V5Y 1N2

skylabHQ.com | Time Zone: NA Pacific [GMT-8]

column9: 2015.05.28 - EMAIL - TIM @ Creastive Cow RE: Chappie/SkyLab Story Opportunities
column28:
Hi Tim!

 

It’s great that Caroline connected these dots! I just wanted to get in touch to see if we could discuss further your interest in a story on our work on Chappie, and possibly beyond. 

 

I have a lot to say about the creative process on Chappie, but as you might already know, at SkyLab we also have created a unique post-production approach to complex, VFX-heavy films. The two aspects really go hand in hand.

 

The workflows we developed on Elysium and Chappie were customized to weave VFX, dailies, editorial and creative color grading seamlessly together on parallel tracks, throughout the finishing process. We have found that this process not only saved time and money to the productions, but actually opened up more creative control for the entire team. 

 

We are excited to share these stories so that we can continue to build behind-the-scenes processes that will enable more time and space for directors, producers and cinematographers to engage creatively in post production.

 

Since Sam Trounce is away for the next couple of weeks, I will be your main point of contact here at SkyLab. Let me know if you have any time to talk in the coming weeks.

 

Best,

Andrea

After briefly discussing the progress on the new SL website, Sam and Andrea decided it might be worthwhile to add some web design vendors to the pool to build momentum and encourage taking the project to the next stage. Andrea will do some quick esearch and pull from contacts pool a list of potential website designers/builders to present to James for SkyLab website project.

Follow up with Tim  via email regarding story (referral from Caroline @ mkm-marcomms )\nAndrea and Sam discussed in last Marketing meeting that Andrea should be the point of contact for now as Sam will be busy and on holiday. Andrea will follow up and try to peak Tim's interest in a more involved story or feature.

column9: Conference call meeting - Jim, Camille, Alexa, JT and CD
column28:
Conference call with Disney - August 18, 2015

ON call: Jim Rota, Alexa Hale, Camille Hidalgo

Jim Hota wants to set up ACES with Disney. 

James described the pipeline for Multi Verse concept. Then and now. 

Jim Rota: We have a lot of problems getting buy in from Disney for ACES. They say it doesn’t work with HDR yet (for instance). They don’t know what they are talking about. Alexa, myself and Camille are able to try to fight this misinformation but we need help with convincing them.

James: We would be happy to find something in Vancouver that you are doing that we can help with. 

Jim - we would like to call on you guys to sit in on some discussions with Disney filmmakers who need to know that it can be done. Of course we could help them with that! 

CD: Who at  Disney sits on the board of Academy? Jim:   Andy Chang 

CD: What's the feeling about cloud resources down there? Jim : ILM does a lot of that in that space. As a sister company to us we are interested in knowing what they are doing. 

CD: How much TV do they touch. Jim - not us - we are the big features group. 

Jim - we have tons of bandwidth. So it would be good to have a live color workflow ACES.

Any Other Business

Jim Rota and Alexa Hale approached Chris Davies after the ACES for VFX presentation at Siggraph. They were interested in discussing consultation for implementing ACES workflows for live-action production at Walt Disney Pictures. They have had resistance so far, but want to engage Chris for "consulting." The conversation was abruptly cut off, so very little info has been exchanged so far.


New Action Items

schedule a follow-up phone call with Jim and Alexa, for Chris and another Skylab team member
	research Jim's and Alexa's experience and background prior to the phone call
